result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L. Denham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Judgment & Certification of Debt returned as undeliverable
Reminder Notice - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.

(3:59 PM cases 21CF1091, 21CF1382, 22CF565, 22CF781 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel L. Denham in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Daniel L. Denham.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Prior offenses acknowledged for repeater enhancers.
Defendant waives reading of Information in cases 22CF565 and 22CF781 and enters pleas. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF1091 Count 2: Carrying a Concealed Knife as Repeater, 21CF1382 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine as Repeater, 22CF565 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping as Repeater, 22CF781 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping without Repeater and Count 6: Domestic Disorderly Conduct as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CF1091 Count 2, 21CF1382 Count 1, 22CF565 Count 1, 22CF781 Count 1 and Count 6.

Court imposes and stays on cases 21CF1382 Count 1 and 22CF565 Count 1: 3 Years Initial Confinement followed by 2 Years Extended Supervision. Court places the defendant on 36 months probation with the following conditions: 9 months jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on 21CF1382 Count 1. Defendant is to apply for and successfully complete Treatment Court. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any contraband is ordered destroyed. 22 days credit on 21CF1382 and 21 days credit on 22CF565. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Court orders sentence on 21CF1091 Count 2, 22CF781 Count 1 and Count 6 for the defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Court orders 22 days credit on 21CF1091 and 19 days credit on 22CF781.

Conditions:
No contact with N.M. or her residence.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
No use or possession of weapons.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF781, 21CF1091, 21CF1382, 22CF565)

(Cases called at 9:49 AM - 21CF1091, 21CF1382, 22CF565, 22CF781)
Defendant Daniel Denham appears in custody with Attorney Francis Rivard.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Cash bond amended to signature bond.  Defendant advised of right to preliminary hearing in 22CF565 and 22CF781.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing- waiver accepted by Court.
Status Conference/Arraignment (22CF565 and 22CF781): July 27, 2022 at 4:00 PM

Case called at 11:20 AM.
Defendant Daniel L. Denham in custody via video conference from the jail from the jail with Public Defender Intern Clayton Cavanaugh and supervising Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.
Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Complaint.  State requests $250 Cash Bond to cover all open cases ( 22CF781, 21CF1091, 21CF1382, 22CF565).
(Failures to appear, continues to commit new crimes). Defendant previously posted $120 Cash in 21CF1382 and 21CF1091 and would be required to post an additional $130 to be released from jail. Court so orders.
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
RTN: 7/20/22 at 9:45 AM (Br 4).

Conditions:
No contact with N.M. or her residence.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
No use or possession of weapons.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF781, 21CF1091, 21CF1382, 22CF565)
